meanings.definition: A compound involved in glycolysis and gluconeogenesis.
meanings.sent1: During glycolysis, phosphoenolpyruvate helps break down glucose into energy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the role of phosphoenolpyruvate in metabolic pathways.
meanings.sent3: The phosphoenolpyruvate molecule decided to take a break from all the chemical reactions.
meanings.sent4: In the complex dance of metabolism, phosphoenolpyruvate is the star performer.
meanings.sent5: The structure of phosphoenolpyruvate resembles a tiny powerhouse within the cell.

meanings.definition: A high-energy molecule used in biochemical reactions.
meanings.sent1: Cells rely on phosphoenolpyruvate to fuel various biochemical processes.
meanings.sent2: Biochemists study the properties of phosphoenolpyruvate to understand energy transfer.
meanings.sent3: The high-energy phosphoenolpyruvate molecule was always the life of the party in the cell.
meanings.sent4: In the intricate web of cellular activities, phosphoenolpyruvate shines like a bright beacon.
meanings.sent5: The sheer power of phosphoenolpyruvate fuels the engine of life within the cell.
